entry.title: [BRP] Unrewrite raw_ptr/raw_ref under Paint code
entry.content:
renderer/platform/graphics/paint, renderer/platform/graphics/compositing and renderer/core/paint are being Oilpanized, which should take precedence over MiraclePtr.



Moreover, we've recently observed some Renderer regressions related to MiraclePtr. While no relation with these pointers have been observed, better to unrewrite things that are unnecessary.



No need for RAW_PTR_EXCLUSION, as the paths are added to kRawPtrManualPathsToIgnore. Ok to keep existing annotations, as they carry information about performance, in case MiraclePtr'ization effort is evered resumed.



Bug: 330759291

Change-Id: I354a3bdd8e5a491b9a61c77fe5bb986072937b6b

entry.title: autosleep: Prevent timer restart when the timezone does not change
entry.content:
The timezone changed callback is called every time the device wakes

from suspend even if the timezone does not change. This can cause

the timer to be incorrectly restarted when the user manually wakes

the device up from sleep. This CL adds a check to prevent running

the timezone change logic when the actual timezone does not change.



Bug: b:319083880

Test: unit_test --gtest_filter=*RepeatingTimeInterval*

Change-Id: I61832215650ca103f0e6dee57a893cac4f924833

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5401893

Reviewed-by: Irina Fedorova

Commit-Queue: Fahad Mansoor

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1279105}

entry.title: [autofill] Fix 3 line suggestion margin
entry.content:
The new autofill design is deducting the horizontal margin in

GetMarginsForContentCell, from 12px to 8px. However, later there is a

specific check for when suggestions have 2 lines labels, where the

vertical margin is increased (which is ok), however it also resets the

horizontal ones back to the default value store in the base popup class



This fix simply makes sure that we only update the vertical margins,

which is what we care about, therefore this is a proper fix.



Nonetheless there is a follow up step to be taken: Make this code simpler to understand and follow. Margins should be

defined in only one place.



Demo:https://screencast.googleplex.com/cast/NDYyMzg3Mjg1Nzk5NzMxMnwxMjIyMzM3Yy1mMQ



bug: b/330912574

entry.title: ash: BootTimeRecorder should not observe OobeUI
entry.content:
BootTimeRecorder should record timings for the restored tabs.

This CL removes BootTimesRecorderTabHelper for OobeUI so that

BootTimeRecorder is not created for OobeUI and does not record

timings for it.



This CL also drops "LoginDone" from "TabPaint" to make login timings

are recorded more consistently. It was added in the thinking that

either the first tab paint or finish of browser session restore

concludes the user login. However, this could hide problems

of slower browser session restores and makes it more difficult to

understand "BootTime.Login2".



Bug: 331407620

entry.title: [Extensions] Change "blessed" -> "privileged" in extension feature files
entry.content:
This CL finishes up previous work to move to a more understandable

language to describe privileged extension contexts for the extension API

feature system to use "privileged" instead of "blessed".



This changes:

'unblessed_extension' -> 'unprivileged_extension'

'blessed_extension' -> 'privileged_extension'

'blessed_web_page' -> 'privileged_web_page'



No behavior change is expected.

entry.title: Reland "Reland "Reorder precedence of Cookie Access Grants""
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit d1cd395e3557aa8690b2f5620c2c1742cedc4ce8



More similar flakes occured for a different (precedence) test case.

this CL updates the conditions to wait for the

content::CookieChangeObserver making sure

test_case_.allow_by_explicit_setting precedence test case is fully

considered.



Original change's description:

> Reland "Reorder precedence of Cookie Access Grants"

>

> This is a reland of commit 9808ffb946ced743655507f56986b0fe9cea5019

>

> The test is flaky at the level histogram bucket count, reporting 1 count instead of 2 base on cookie write/reads with ExecJs. This reland disables the flaky platforms with a tracking bug to resolve the flakiness.

>

> Original change's description:

> > Reorder precedence of Cookie Access Grants

> >

> > This CL set precedence to allow first priority consideration of our long term solutions, to enhance visibility on their web ecosystem adoption.

> > Similarly, sites controlled mechanisms should be check before Chrome

> > ones, and user controlled mechanisms should come last as in an ideal

> > scenario users shouldn't need to trigger them.

> >

> > The predefined and defaulted controls will always come first.

> >

> > OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAMS=histogram PageLoad.Clients.TPCD.CookieAccess.ThirdPartyCookieAllowMechanism2 is replaced by PageLoad.Clients.TPCD.CookieAccess.ThirdPartyCookieAllowMechanism3

> >

> > OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAMS=histogram PageLoad.Clients.TPCD.TPCAccess.CookieReadStatus is replaced by PageLoad.Clients.TPCD.TPCAccess.CookieReadStatus2

> >

> > OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAMS=histogram API.StorageAccess.AllowedRequests2 is replaced by API.StorageAccess.AllowedRequests3

> >

> > OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAMS=histogram Tpcd.Mitigations.Dt.FirstParty.Deployment is replaced by Tpcd.Mitigations.Dt.FirstParty.Deployment2

> >

> >

> > Change-Id: Iebe37f089a1f25fc07d78446851ca5a6d2175165

> > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5331513

entry.title: Update OAuthHostStarter to use DirectoryServiceClient
entry.content:
OAuthHostStarterImpl (renamed to OAuthHostStarter in this CL) relied

on ServiceClient to make the register and delete service calls to

our backend. I had planned on updating ServiceClient to use callbacks

rather than a delegate interface but when I looked at the

ServiceClient impl, it didn't really do anything useful. It may have

been helpful when we had HostStarter and HostStopper classes but

that is consolidated now and the class also obscured the response

codes we get back from the service.



Thus in this CL I move HttpProtobufStatus error handling into the

base class, removed ServiceClient, and updated OAuthHostStarter to

use the DirectoryServiceClient directly which cleaned up its

implementation a bit as well.



I also renamed OAuthHostStarterImpl to OAuthHostStarter because the

'Impl ' suffix was redundant.



Bug: b/320745119, b/330404222

Change-Id: I3bff874413226482cbb95afd97f822d03d3b49e9

entry.title: hunspell: Remove LineIterator::AdvanceAndCopy in our bdict patch
entry.content:
This cleanup is in preparation for reworking bdict_reader.cc to use

spans for bounds-checking and also avoid a UBSan error caused by invalid

pointer casts. But I wanted to get this method out of the way first.



Previously, we would copy into a 65K buffer embedded in FileMgr. This

buffer seems to have been copied from the original upstream FileMgr.

Interestingly, upstream doesn't seem to actually use it either. It was

removed in

https://github.com/hunspell/hunspell/commit/42b8e241afcd1576a5e670aebd20f965260c32d7

and never cleaned up.



Regardless, we don't need it because we already keep the entire bdict in

memory and return a NUL-terminated C string. We can simply return that

directly. This also fixes a bug / weird behavior: AdvanceAndCopy would

truncate the line to the output buffer. In doing so, it didn't find the

end of the string, so we'd actually split the element in two and return

a *different* sequence of lines than if we called Advance.



Change-Id: I980fe2f9b197fe24c717d65e9d693dd6a7539053

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5388542

Auto-Submit: David Benjamin

Reviewed-by: Anthony Cui

Commit-Queue: Anthony Cui

entry.title: [Clipboard] Mark passwords as sensitive in Android.
entry.content:
When privacy type is set as `kNoDisplay`, mark the data copied to

plain text format as EXTRA_IS_SENSITIVE and set the password data.



Callers that set this privacy type, copy the password in plain text

format which is not treated as concealed data, so setting the

password data via `setPassword` treats the data as confidential.



Continuation of crrev.com/c/5347639 to extend privacy features on

platforms that support adding confidential data such as passwords.



Bug: 40945200



Change-Id: Ia4cc9d6d67687519dbe3f0643591a2ecb67fca81

entry.title: [Reland 1] lens overlay: Fix context menu entry point.
entry.content:
The original CL modifies a kombucha test. The modified test fails in

ubsan builds. This appears to be a race condition in kombucha itself, as

kombucha steps run nested by default. This reland takes all the kombucha

steps and flushes events after every step to avoid this

non-deterministic and racy behavior.



> This CL allows us to correctly hook up the CUJ test. This CL prevents

> lens overlay from triggering for non-normal windows.



Bug: 331114227

entry.title: Add VisitedLinkNavigationThrottle to retrieve origin salt
entry.content:
This CL creates a navigation throttle to identify the visited link salt

value corresponding to the navigation's origin to be committed. This

salt is then added to the navigation's commit_params. In later CLs, we

will retrieve this value from the commit_params and access it (via

Document) in VisitedLinkState in the renderer.



These salt values are generated and stored in VisitedLinkWriter. Each

unique origin has a unique uint64_t salt value used when hashing the

partitioned :visited link hashtable.



In this CL, salts are generated but not currently used in creating the

hashtable. But will be used to partition the hashtable in future CLs.



Design Doc: https://docs.google.com/document/d/19qYPkfPNkPnmVcZ6jjl7jR8JPKY6j4rTjfoFRHll2IQ/edit?usp=sharing



Fixed: 329046735

entry.title: [ASH] Fix a bug in returning the package name via identity sharing
entry.content:
LauncherIntentDispatcher#getCallingPackageIdentitySharing had a bug that

could return a wrong non-null package name as opposed to returning

the correct calling app's package name due to the way Chrome handles

the incoming intent using a trampoline activity. This CL fixes it:



- Just like how the dispatcher populates the intent data provider with

the right package name from service connection/startActivityForResult,

we define a new param in the provider for the package name obtained

from identity sharing API.

- Revert the API above to private, non-static, since it returns the

package name of the trampline activity instead of that of the calling

app if passed CustomTabActivity.

entry.title: cryptohome: Add new kRestoreKey intent
entry.content:
In the Cryptohome backend key restore happens only if the AuthSession

is authenticated with kRestoreIntent. Currently key eviction test

setup is broken since Chrome lock screen doesn't start the AuthSession

with this intent. Fix this issue by adding kRestoreKey intent for key

restore operation.



This intent requires a full access to user secret stash however doesn't

grant permissions to change authentication methods. This restriction is

needed for the next phases of the key eviction project where there will

be multiple instances of Chrome and we actively avoid double

authentication by the user, avoiding security vulnerabilities at the

same time.



BUG=b:323896336

TEST=Unit tests pass

TEST=Build ChromeOS with USE=key_eviction and flash the image

TEST=Build simple Chrome with this CL and deploy

TEST=See that key is restored on lock screen after suspend when user

enters their password.

entry.title: media/gpu/chromeos: Change default frame type to NativePixmap
entry.content:
This changes the FrameResource backing type from VideoFrame to

NativePixmap for frames in a PlatformVideoFramePool when the default

frame creation function is used. This should change the FrameResource

backing type on ChromeOS VA-API decoders and V4L2 stateful decoders.



This also changes the input VideoFrame::StorageType for the VAAPI image

processor when it is created for VideoDecoderPipeline. If the image

processor is being used, then the input frames are allocated by the

auciliary frame pool. This change affects the auxiliary frame pool type,

so the input type is being changed.

be accessed from multiple worlds. This is an overstatement: it is a

little inefficient to use in a pure single-world case, but it has value

as an easy tool for returning the same promise repeatedly.

build a variant specifically for the single-world case.

entry.content:

a long migration (which may have tens of thousands of files). On

most systems, there is a limit on the number of open file descriptors

at any given time (usually around 4096), so this is necessary for

large transfers.

entry.title: peerconnection: Fire data channel events synchronously
entry.content:
When message events are dispatched asynchronously, it is possible to

receive some of those after the state change events are dispatched.

This causes some messages to disappear when a data channel is closing.



Tests are added to verify that all messages sent are received properly

by the remote side as mandated by the specification.

entry.title: media/gpu/chromeos: Make frame pool unit tests set frame storage type
entry.content:
The PlatformVideoFramePool has unit tests which set a custom allocator.

However, the unit test did not use the pool's SetCustomFrameAllocator()

method, which requires both the frame allocator callback (stored in

|create_frame_cb_|) and the frame storage type (stored in

|frame_storage_type_|).



This caused issues with the next CL in this chain, which changes the

default value of |frame_storage_type_| to STORAGE_DMABUFS.



This changes the unit tests to use SetCustomFrameAllocator() and to

specify the frame storage types for the tests' frame allocators. It

removes the test function SetCreateFrameCB(), which is no longer used.



Bug: b:277581596

Test: All/PlatformVideoFramePoolTest unit tests pass.

entry.title: [//gpu] Pass MacOS-specific texture target in SharedImageCapabilities
entry.content:
ClientSharedImage will use this field where it currently uses the

global `macos_specific_texture_target` in GetTextureTarget(). This will

enable decoupling ClientSharedImage::GetTextureTarget() from

GetPlatformSpecificTextureTarget() and eventually eliminating the

latter, as well as the global `macos_specific_texture_target` itself and

all the infrastructure around it.



Note that there is no new info being passed between processes here, as

this state is already available in all processes via

GetPlatformSpecificTextureTarget().



Bug: 41494843

Change-Id: I834daae539553af0871166503e998968b0c94ebc

entry.title: view-transition: Discard transition on old Document on navigation abort
entry.content:
Ensure that the transition on the old Document is discarded if the

navigation is aborted after the snapshot is initiated in the renderer.

This avoids the old ViewTransition keeping a rendering suppression

lock on the Document.



The above was implicitly not an issue because we were skipping the

transition in the renderer once the snapshot was done. But this doesn't

align with the spec which skips the transition as a part of running the

visibility change steps. It's also better to skip the transition later

to prevent the old Document from pumping new frames until the new

Document is committed. So the fix is paired with removing the skipping

of transition at the end of the snapshot.



Fixed: 329713873

Change-Id: I9b17ba7539facb7ddc4d3c88be32200a0610b6a7

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5391886

entry.title: Limit number of report states per source as a Vendor Specific Value
entry.content:
When the number of states is sufficiently high, the channel capacity is

virtually zero, guaranteeing a randomized response. Making it a

configurable limit allows us to search for an optimal state limit to

save computational resources in generating random responses and let end

users configure their source registrations more optimally.



The limit is configurable in interop testing.



Bug: 330863446

entry.title: vt: Fix snapshots when browser controls are animating
entry.content:
This CL fixes snapshot capture when browser controls are animating.

Browser controls start animating to shown at navigation start. A capture

is started at navigation commit. If the animation is still running at

commit time, the capture is requested while controls are partially

showing, which requires some adjustments.



https://crrev.com/c/5366846 made it so that Blink is reliably resized

prior to capture. There are three additional adjustments made here:



1) We can now use `BrowserControls::ShrinkViewport`, which comes from

the resize, to determine whether to outset a snapshot.



2) Cancel the controls animation and force them to be fully shown when

the capture is requested. This ensures the transitioning elements will

be captured in the locations they'll appear in on the incoming page.



3) However, the controls animation can (conditionally) counter-scroll

the root scroller to give an effect of the controls overlaying the

content. This happens only if the page is not at the top[1]. To account

for this, the counter scroll is preemptively applied in Blink. However,

since the compositor may be ticking animations while Blink is running

the BeginMainFrame, we also implement a way to tell the compositor to

drop any active scroll delta since Blink has already scrolled to the

desired final position.



[1] https://crrev.com/5ef8262

entry.title: Avoid sending oversized display rects through ozone wayland
entry.content:
Wayland surface augmenter uses 'wl_fixed_t' which only supports scales

up to 23 bit integers. For some reason specific pages [1] create

malformed enormous quad rects. Since we cannot send these rects

through wayland we must fail delegation and composite.



[1]

https://gtowizard.com/en/

entry.title: [PA] Add PRESUBMIT.py for PartitionAlloc include guards
entry.content:
Currently, all PartitionAlloc headers are include-guarded with a guard

name like `BASE_ALLOCATOR_PARTITION_ALLOCATOR_SRC_PARTITION_ALLOC_

PARTITION_ALLOC_H_`.



This does not match with the fact that recent update,

https://crbug.com/40276913, made it possible to include PA headers like:

```

#include "partition_alloc/partition_alloc_for_testing.h"

```



This chain of CLs will rewrite these include guards in three steps.

1. Allow-list PA directory from the top-level `PRESUBMIT.py` check for

include guard names.

[[ https://crrev.com/c/5384972 ]]

2. Rewrite existing PA headers to use new guard names.

[[ https://crrev.com/c/5384737 ]]

3. Add PA-level PRESUBMIT.py to enforce new guard names.

[[ This CL ]]



The new PRESUBMIT.py rule enforces a stricter rule over guard naming in

PA. It requires the name to be compliant with the style guide, as

commented in the script. The rule is tested against all existing headers

in PA locally and it is confirmed that all of them are using the

standard naming style.



Bug: 40276913

Change-Id: I71c5d3ab97b9cf1f9aa4cfe542e6c570e87f7360

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5384659

Reviewed-by: Arthur Sonzogni

Reviewed-by: Bartek Nowierski

Commit-Queue: Mikihito Matsuura

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1278939}

entry.title: Mark DocumentToken on PrefetchContainerKey optional for browser-initiated prefetch
entry.content:
Currently, PrefetchContainer uses the referring DocumentToken and

prefetch_url pair as an identity key.

Regarding introducing browser-initiated prefetch, we need to revisit the

usage of DocumentToken since there will be no concept of the referring

DocumentToken in such triggers.



As the straightforward expansion of the current keying system to

browser-initiated prefetch, this CL marks DocumentToken optional to

allow PrefetchContainer to handle empty DocumentToken case.



This CL doesn't change any existing behavior of current speculation

rules prefetch.



Note that the current DocumentToken-based mechanism is planning to be

migrated to the NIK-based key system [1] in near future.

Please see [2] for more context and plan.



[1] https://docs.google.com/document/d/1z3BTb3jEfyvUJIFJCc7e9UKB5dIZlGRHFhpU8R_s66M



[2] https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Cr4MyJAA42c1m7MrEHgH_IIlKHA6EfiBdRGpP_RiDKQ/edit?resourcekey=0-ySgOZBi6gdfSRwe3ZYWOLA&tab=t.0#heading=h.vr3i7u9fzq01



Bug: 40946257, 40942681

entry.title: PasswordSyncBridge: Stop using SyncMetadataStoreChangeList::TakeError()
entry.content:
SyncMetadataStoreChangeList::TakeError() is deprecated - this pattern

makes it too easy to accidentally forget to check for an error.

This CL migrates PasswordSyncBridge (the last user of TakeError()) to

the new pattern, which is passing an error callback to the

SyncMetadataStoreChangeList.

A followup CL will remove TakeError().

entry.title: [PA] Exclude PA from toplevel PRESUBMIT.py include guard check
entry.content:
Currently, all PartitionAlloc headers are include-guarded with a guard

name like `BASE_ALLOCATOR_PARTITION_ALLOCATOR_SRC_PARTITION_ALLOC_

PARTITION_ALLOC_H_`.



This does not match with the fact that recent update,

https://crbug.com/40276913, made it possible to include PA headers like:

```

#include "partition_alloc/partition_alloc_for_testing.h"

```



This chain of CLs will rewrite these include guards in three steps.

1. Allow-list PA directory from the top-level `PRESUBMIT.py` check for

include guard names.

[[ This CL ]]

2. Rewrite existing PA headers to use new guard names.

[[ https://crrev.com/c/5384737 ]]

3. Add PA-level PRESUBMIT.py to enforce new guard names.

[[ https://crrev.com/c/5384659 ]]



Bug: 40276913

Change-Id: Iedbbce834fdfe36f48d3d062e42450cbb77bd8c0

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5384972

Reviewed-by: Daniel Cheng

Reviewed-by: Arthur Sonzogni

Commit-Queue: Mikihito Matsuura

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1278910}

entry.title: [iOS] Pass tracker to credential extension use notification function
entry.content:
For future migration of promo interest signals from user defaults to FET

we need to pass through the feature engagement tracker.



For credential extension use, we need to save that information until

feature engagement tracker is available.



Bug: b/329280828
